Utterance: Hi again! It’s great to see you. How have you been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! I’ve been doing a bit better. I reached out to a couple of people in the industry.
That’s fantastic! How did it go?
Surprisingly well! One of them responded and invited me to a small gathering of performers next week.
That’s wonderful news! How does that make you feel?
Honestly, I’m excited but also a bit anxious about meeting new people.
It’s perfectly normal to feel that way. What strategies do you think might help you manage that anxiety when you’re at the gathering?
I could use the breathing exercises we practiced. Maybe I’ll also remind myself that everyone there has been in my shoes before.
Those are excellent strategies! Focusing on common ground can help ease the pressure. What are you most looking forward to about the gathering?
I’m looking forward to hearing about what other performers are doing and hopefully getting some advice.
That’s a great mindset! It sounds like you’re ready to learn and connect.
I hope so!
You are! Let’s also touch on your work at the call center. How have things been there since we last spoke?
It’s been a bit less hectic, thankfully. I’ve been trying to apply the mindfulness techniques.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Current Functional Status

Utterance: That’s great to hear! How have they been working for you?
They’ve helped me stay focused during busy shifts. I feel less overwhelmed.
Classified_Subsection: Mental Health Observations: Current Functional Status

Utterance: That’s a significant improvement! Have you noticed any changes in how you respond to mistakes at work?
I’m not as hard on myself anymore. I realize it’s part of the job.
That’s a huge step forward! Recognizing that mistakes are a natural part of learning can be liberating.
Yeah, it really is.
Are there any other areas of your life where you’d like to apply that same mindset?
I think I need to apply it to my creative work too. I often feel like everything has to be perfect before I share it.
That’s a common struggle for many creative individuals. What if you allowed yourself to share something that isn’t perfect?
That sounds scary, but I think it could be freeing.
It can be! Maybe you could set a goal to share a piece of work with someone, even if it’s not finished.
I could try that.
Excellent! Let’s aim for that as a goal for our next session.
Okay, I’ll work on it.
Before we wrap up, is there anything else on your mind today?
I think that’s all for now.
Alright! It’s been a pleasure talking with you. Remember to be gentle with yourself as you explore these new opportunities.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate your support!
You’re welcome! Looking forward to our next session. Goodbye!
Goodbye!
